intro: Lepidium praetervisum, commonly known as the slender cress, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, with slender stems and small, bright green leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish-white, and arranged in racemes, typical of the family. The plant produces small, round, green pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
